alert.note: Alert for Beaverhead; Madison (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 27 at 7:19PM MST until November 27 at 8:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northwestern Madison County in southwestern Montana... Central Beaverhead County in southwestern Montana... * Until 800 PM MST. * At 718 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 8 miles north of Sheridan to 13 miles west of Dillon, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Dillon, Sheridan, Twin Bridges, Alder, Beaverhead Rock State Park, Bannack, Laurin, Clark Canyon and Bannack State Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
